types.name: AccountState
types.description: Represents a raw account state.  This is meant to represent a raw storage state void of any application layer context and/or logic.  In particular, this does not deal with currency or fungible asset value directly, which requires additional information on currency such as its ticker and possible minters, etc. while interpreting the data retrieved with the provided contextual information. The same is true for validator sets.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Balance at given address and currency hash pair.

args.name: currencyHash
args.description: The currency hash to look up.

fields.deprecationReason: Does not work post block protocol version 7.

args.description: The currency hash to look up.

fields.name: blockIndex
fields.description: Block index at the latest executed action.

fields.name: dailyRewardReceivedIndex
fields.description: Block index at the DailyReward execution.

fields.name: index
fields.description: The index of this avatar state among its agent's avatar addresses.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Block index at the latest executed action.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Fungible asset value ticker and amount.

fields.name: difficulty
fields.description: The mining difficulty that the block's nonce has to satisfy.
fields.deprecationReason: Block does not have Difficulty field in PBFT.

fields.name: nonce
fields.description: The proof-of-work nonce which satisfies the required difficulty.
fields.deprecationReason: Block does not have Nonce field in PBFT.

fields.name: previousBlock
fields.description: The previous block.  If it's a genesis block (i.e., its index is 0) this must be null.

fields.name: protocolVersion
fields.description: The protocol version number of the block.

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: The public key of the Miner.

fields.name: signature
fields.description: The digital signature of the whole block content (except for hash, which is derived from the signature and other contents)

fields.name: stateRootHash
fields.description: The hash of the resulting states after evaluating transactions and a block action (if exists)

fields.name: totalDifficulty
fields.description: The total mining difficulty since the genesis including the block's difficulty.
fields.deprecationReason: Block does not have TotalDifficulty field in PBFT.

fields.name: blockHash
fields.description: The hash of the block which contains block commit.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The height of the block commit.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round of the block commit.

fields.name: votes
fields.description: Total votes of the block commit.

args.name: desc
args.description: Whether to query blocks in descending order or not.

args.name: limit
args.description: The maximum number of blocks to return.  This limits the offset index range to query, not the result, i.e. excluded blocks due to a block being empty or not matching the miner (if specified in other arguments) are still counted.

args.name: offset
args.description: The offset of the first queried block.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: The public key of the peer.

fields.name: index
fields.description: Slot Index at the combination slot

fields.name: startBlockIndex
fields.description: Block index at the combination started.

fields.name: unlockBlockIndex
fields.description: Block index at the combination slot can be usable.

args.name: avatarAddress
args.description: Avatar address to craft event item

args.name: eventConsumableItemRecipeId
args.description: Recipe ID of event item to craft

args.description: Target slot index to craft item

args.name: eventMaterialItemRecipeId
args.description: Recipe ID of event item to craft

args.name: materialsToUse
args.description: Materials to be used to craft

fields.name: decimalPlaces
fields.description: The number of digits to treat as minor units (i.e., exponents).

fields.name: hash
fields.description: The deterministic hash derived from other fields.

fields.name: maximumSupply
fields.description: The uppermost quantity of currency allowed to exist.  null means unlimited supply.

fields.name: minters
fields.description: The addresses who can mint this currency.  If this is null anyone can mint the currency.  On the other hand, unlike null, an empty set means no one can mint the currency.

fields.name: totalSupplyTrackable
fields.description: Whether the total supply of this currency is trackable.

types.name: CurrencyEnum
types.description: The currency type.

inputFields.name: decimalPlaces
inputFields.description: The number of digits to treat as minor units (i.e., exponents).

inputFields.name: minters
inputFields.description: The addresses who can mint this currency.  If this is null anyone can mint the currency.  On the other hand, unlike null, an empty set means no one can mint the currency.

inputFields.name: totalSupplyTrackable
inputFields.description: Whether the total supply of this currency is trackable.

types.name: DateTimeOffset
types.description: The `DateTimeOffset` scalar type represents a date, time and offset from UTC. `DateTimeOffset` expects timestamps to be formatted in accordance with the [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Indicates the block height that infraction has been occurred.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier derived from this Evidence content

fields.name: targetAddress
fields.description: Indicates the address of the target that caused the infraction.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Indicates the timestamp the infraction occurred.

types.name: EvidenceQuery
types.description: Retrieve evidence information.

types.name: FungibleAssetValue
types.description: Holds a fungible asset value which holds its currency together.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency of the fungible asset.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The value quantity without its currency in string, e.g., "123.45".

fields.name: sign
fields.description: Gets a number that indicates the sign (-1: negative, 1: positive, or 0: zero) of the value.

fields.name: string
fields.description: The value quantity with its currency in string, e.g., "123.45 ABC".

types.name: HelperQuery
types.description: A number of queries for convenience.

args.name: hex
args.description: The byte array in hex representation to decode.

fields.name: currencyHash
fields.description: Converts currency info to currency hash.

fields.name: keyHex
fields.description: Converts string to key hex representation

args.name: value
args.description: The string value to convert to key hex.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: base64
fields.description: A base64 representation of the bencodex value encoded to byte array.

fields.name: hex
fields.description: A hexadecimal representation of the bencodex value encoded as byte array.

fields.name: inspection
fields.description: A human readable representation of the bencodex value.

fields.name: json
fields.description: A JSON representation of the bencodex value

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

args.name: ids
args.description: Ids for fetching only equipment where id (number) is in the given argument.

args.name: itemIds
args.description: ItemIds for fetching only equipment where itemId (Guid) is in the given argument.

args.name: itemSubType
args.description: An item subtype for fetching only equipment where its subtype is the same. If it wasn't given, you'll get all equipment without relationship to the subtype.

args.name: inventoryItemId
args.description: An Id to find Inventory Item

enumValues.name: CHEST
enumValues.deprecationReason: ItemSubType.Chest has never been used outside the MaterialItemSheet. And we won't use it in the future until we have a specific reason.

fields.name: privateKey
fields.description: An API to provide conversion to public-key, address.

args.name: hex
args.description: A representation of public-key with hexadecimal format.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Retrieves balance from the legacy account.

fields.name: states
fields.description: Retrieves states from the legacy account.

fields.name: totalSupply
fields.description: Retrieves total supply from the legacy account.

fields.name: validators
fields.description: Retrieves validator set from the legacy account.

fields.name: bootstrapEnded
fields.description: Whether the current libplanet node has ended bootstrapping.

fields.name: genesis
fields.description: Block header of the genesis block from the current chain.

fields.name: informationalVersion
fields.description: A informational version (a.k.a. version suffix) of NineChronicles.Headless

fields.name: isMining
fields.description: Whether the current node is mining.

fields.name: preloadEnded
fields.description: Whether the current libplanet node has ended preloading.

fields.name: stagedTxIds
fields.description: Ids of staged transactions from the current node.

fields.name: stagedTxIdsCount
fields.description: The number of ids of staged transactions from the current node.

fields.name: subscriberAddressesCount
fields.description: The number of a list of subscribers' address

fields.name: tip
fields.description: Block header of the tip block from the current canonical chain.

fields.name: topmostBlocks
fields.description: The topmost blocks from the current node.

args.name: limit
args.description: The number of blocks to get.

args.name: miner
args.description: List only blocks mined by the given address.  (List everything if omitted.)

args.name: offset
args.description: The number of blocks to skip from tip.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Summary of other peers connected to this node. It consists of address, chain height, and total difficulty.

fields.name: hex
fields.description: A representation of private-key with hexadecimal format.

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: A public-key derived from the private-key.

fields.name: address
fields.description: An address derived from the public-key.

fields.name: hex
fields.description: A representation of public-key with hexadecimal format.

args.name: compress
args.description: A flag to determine whether to compress public-key.

fields.name: stageClearedBlockIndex
fields.description: Block index at Latest stage cleared.

fields.name: trie
fields.description: Retrieves trie from given state root hash.

fields.name: diffs
fields.description: List of state differences under this root.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path to the root state difference.

fields.name: clients
fields.description: List of address connected to this node.

fields.name: clientsByDevice
fields.description: clients connected to this node by device.

fields.name: clientsByIps
fields.description: clients connected to this node grouped by Ip addresses.

fields.name: clientsCountByIps
fields.description: clients count connected to this node grouped by Ip addresses.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: total count by connected to this node.

fields.name: totalCountByDevice
fields.description: total count by connected to this node.

types.name: SimplifyFungibleAssetValueInput
types.description: A fungible asset value ticker and amount.You can specify either currencyEnum or currencyTicker.

inputFields.description: A currency type to be loaded.

inputFields.name: currencyTicker
inputFields.description: A currency ticker to be loaded.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: A numeric string to parse.  Can consist of digits, plus (+), minus (-), and decimal separator (.). <see cref="FungibleAssetValue.Parse(Currency, string)" />

fields.name: achievements
fields.deprecationReason: Since StakeStateV2, the achievement became removed.

fields.name: cancellableBlockIndex
fields.description: The block index the user can cancel the staking.

fields.name: claimableBlockIndex
fields.description: The block index the user can claim rewards.

fields.name: receivedBlockIndex
fields.description: The block index the user received rewards.

fields.name: startedBlockIndex
fields.description: The block index the user started to stake.

fields.name: keyStore
fields.deprecationReason: Use `planet key` command instead.  https://www.npmjs.com/package/@planetarium/cli

fields.name: stageTransaction
fields.description: Add a new transaction to staging and return TxId

args.name: payload
args.description: The hexadecimal string of the transaction to stage.

fields.name: stageTx
fields.description: Add a new transaction to staging

args.name: payload
args.description: The base64-encoded bytes for new transaction.

fields.name: stageTxV2
fields.description: Add a new transaction to staging and return TxId

args.name: payload
args.description: The base64-encoded bytes for new transaction.

fields.deprecationReason: API update with action query. use stageTransaction mutation

args.name: amount
args.description: A string value of the value to be transferred.

args.name: currencyAddress
args.description: A hex-encoded value for address of currency to be transferred. The default is the NCG's address.

args.name: recipient
args.description: A hex-encoded value for address of recipient.

args.name: txNonce
args.description: A sender's transaction counter. You can get it through nextTxNonce().

fields.name: transferGold
fields.deprecationReason: Incorrect remittance may occur when using transferGold() to the same address consecutively. Use transfer() instead.

fields.name: accountDiffs
fields.description: This field allows you to query the diffs based accountAddress between two blocks. `baseIndex` is the reference block index, and changedIndex is the block index from which to check what changes have occurred relative to `baseIndex`. Both indices must not be higher than the current block on the chain nor lower than the genesis block index (0). The difference between the two blocks must be greater than zero for a valid comparison and less than ten for performance reasons.

args.name: baseIndex
args.description: The index of the reference block from which the state is retrieved.

args.name: changedIndex
args.description: The index of the target block for comparison.

args.name: publicKey
args.description: The hexadecimal string of public key for Transaction.

args.name: timestamp
args.description: The time this transaction is created.

fields.name: activated
fields.deprecationReason: Since NCIP-15, it doesn't care account activation.

fields.name: activationKeyNonce
fields.deprecationReason: Since NCIP-15, it doesn't care account activation.

fields.name: activationStatus
fields.description: Check if the provided address is activated.
fields.deprecationReason: Since NCIP-15, it doesn't care account activation.

fields.name: chainQuery
fields.deprecationReason: Use /graphql/explorer

fields.name: diffs
fields.description: This field allows you to query the diffs between two blocks. `baseIndex` is the reference block index, and changedIndex is the block index from which to check what changes have occurred relative to `baseIndex`. Both indices must not be higher than the current block on the chain nor lower than the genesis block index (0). The difference between the two blocks must be greater than zero for a valid comparison and less than ten for performance reasons.

args.name: baseIndex
args.description: The index of the reference block from which the state is retrieved.

args.name: changedIndex
args.description: The index of the target block for comparison.

fields.name: getTx
fields.deprecationReason: The root query is not the best place for getTx so it was moved. Use transaction.getTx()

fields.name: keyStore
fields.deprecationReason: Use `planet key` command instead.  https://www.npmjs.com/package/@planetarium/cli

fields.name: monsterCollectionStatus
fields.description: Get monster collection status by address.

fields.name: nextTxNonce
fields.deprecationReason: The root query is not the best place for nextTxNonce so it was moved. Use transaction.nextTxNonce()

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: A list of actions in this transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier derived from this transaction content.

fields.name: nonce
fields.description: The number of previous transactions committed by the signer of this tx.

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: A PublicKey of the account who signed this transaction.

fields.name: serializedPayload
fields.description: A serialized tx payload in base64 string.

fields.name: signature
fields.description: A digital signature of the content of this transaction.

fields.name: signer
fields.description: An address of the account who signed this transaction.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The time this transaction was created and signed.

fields.name: updatedAddresses
fields.description: Addresses whose states were affected by Actions.

fields.name: inputState

fields.name: outputState

args.name: hex

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the 'if' argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the 'if' argument is true.
